overview.summary: A full-stack issue tracker web application inspired by tools like GitHub Issues and Jira. Built as a team project using a React single-page application frontend and a FastAPI backend, focusing on client-side routing, API integration, and structured project management features.
overview.problem: Managing projects, issues, and team members requires clear data organization, responsive user interfaces, and reliable communication between frontend and backend systems.
overview.solution: A modular issue tracking system with a RESTful FastAPI backend and a React frontend, allowing users to manage projects, members, labels, and issues through a clean single-page interface.

responsibilities: Worked as part of a team to design and implement a full-stack web application
Developed React components and pages using client-side routing with React Router
Integrated frontend features with a REST API using HTTP requests
Implemented issue management features including creation, assignment, filtering, and status updates
Collaborated on backend API structure and data contracts
Used GitHub Issues and milestones to organize development tasks

architecture.approach: Client–server architecture with a single-page React application consuming a RESTful FastAPI backend, developed collaboratively with clear separation of concerns.
architecture.data_flow: The React frontend sends HTTP requests to the FastAPI backend, which processes data and returns JSON responses used to update application state and UI.
architecture.deployment: Not deployed. The application is intended to be run locally for development and evaluation.

key_features: Member and label management within projects
Assignment of members and labels to issues
challenges_and_learnings: Coordinating frontend and backend development in a team environment
Managing application state across multiple routes
Implementing combined filtering and search logic
Collaborating using GitHub Issues and milestones
skills_demonstrated: Project and task organization using GitHub
future_improvements: Add persistent storage with a database
Deploy the application to a production environment
